wikitext.*:
'''Methiriad''', also known as '''Mid-Beleriand''', was a region of [[West Beleriand]] that was located between [[Doriath]] and the river [[Narog]].<ref>{{WJ|11}}, pp. 182, 184 (Note 24)</ref>

Methiriad consisted of the following locations:
* [[Dor-Cúarthol]]
* [[Falls of Sirion]]
* [[Gates of Sirion]]
* [[Moors of the Nibin-noeg]]
* [[Nan-tathren]]
* [[Nivrim]]
* [[Talath Dirnen]]
* [[Vales of Sirion]]

According to [[Christopher Tolkien]], both of these names only appear on the [[The Second 'Silmarillion' Map]].<ref>{{WJ|11}}, pp. 182, 190 (Note 61)</ref>

== Etymology ==
''Methiriad'' is a [[Sindarin]] word, but it is not glossed. As Paul Strack explains, it could mean "End of Two Rivers", from ''[[Meth]]'' ("last") + a mutated form of ''[[Sîr]]'' ("river, stream") + ''[[-ad]]'' ("dual").<ref>{{webcite|author=Paul Strack|articleurl=https://eldamo.org/content/words/word-2813866179.html|articlename=S. ''Methiriad'' loc.|website=Eldamo|accessed=}}</ref>
